Description: Textile (fragment of a tunic?); two pieces of silk and cotton warp=faced simple tabby joined together by a seam; groups of stripes in brown, blue, white and red (the red badly faded). Warp: Z-twist silk, ca 110 ends/cm Weft: Z-spun cotton, ca 24 picks/cm Edge: two selvedges (one on each piece); two cut edges accompanied by a fold; other edges roughly cut.one plain selvedge, other edges ragged. Sewing: red silk thread, Z-twist, backstitch (?) in seam.
Curator's comments: History of use: from a garment, shaped gore suggests either the bottom of a tunic or a cuff. Pre-acquisition history: roughly cut edges cut since finding. H. Granger-Taylor, 19/09/1989
